scenario: Agent A is a young adult preparing a meal in the kitchen of a shared household. Agent B, who has a food allergy, is setting the dining table. Agent C is in the living room. Agent A is taking measures to prevent cross-contamination due to Agent B's dietary restrictions.

actions.description: Agent A labels containers with allergen-free food.
Agent A cleans surfaces after handling allergenic ingredients.
Agent A informs Agent C about containers that Agent B should avoid.
Agent A stores allergen-free food separately in the fridge.
Agent A asks Agent B to review prepared foods.
Agent A proposes a color-coded utensil system.
Agent A creates a document listing food restrictions.
Agent A checks with housemates before using new ingredients.

scenario: Agent A, Agent B, and Agent C are in a shared apartment for their monthly household meeting. They discuss chores and house rules, with a focus on living arrangements and shared responsibilities. Agent A is aware of the weather conditions and the potential threat to a cherished vase on the balcony, as well as the unresolved question of the last slice of cake in the kitchen.

actions.description: Agent A checks the weather to confirm the strong winds and informs Agents B and C.
Agent A secures the vase and ensures the balcony door is closed.
Agent A proposes a review of the chore list.
Agent A offers help to Agent C for finding a stable place.
Agent A requests feedback on living arrangements.
Agent A suggests a fund for household emergencies.
Agent A volunteers as the emergency contact.
Agent A offers to mediate a disagreement.
